CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 28, 1967, page 1, reads: "Mothers March. A Group of some 30 mothers from the Northview Heights Public Housing Community presented a demand to School Supt. Sidney P. Marland Wednesday morning that Mrs. Helen Amos, a teacher at Northview Heights Elementary, be transferred from the school because of her views on public housing residents which she expressed in a letter to the New Courier (Oct. 21). Dr. Marland had not reached a decision at presstime. Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Protesters marching in front Pittsburgh Board of Education building and carrying signs reading "To Heaven With Mrs. Amos," "We Want Better Teachers," and "Public Housing People Are Not Animals We Want Better Teachers," Bellefield Avenue, Oakland
